heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 08 October 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (192°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 10.1°C), outside temperature (down 9.2°C), and inside temperature (down 3.5°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 371 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in outside temperature (up 10.7°C), cloud levels (up 353 m), and inside temperature (up 4.2°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 370.8m lower than yesterday, 242.8m lower than the past week, 352.8m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 993m minimum and 2630m maximum, with an average of 1251.7m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1494.4m and 1604.5m.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should remain cool. Outside; freezing temperatures are anticipated. Also, little or no wind. Possible light showers, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and it’s dim outside. Stable conditions are expected under a high pressure system.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (1.4°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
